author: AOL Staff
title: Joao Pedro on the spot as Brighton thump Tottenham
text: Joao Pedro on the spot as Brighton thump Tottenham Tottenham‚Äôs Premier League revival was halted in emphatic fashion after two Joao Pedro penalties and a stunning strike from Pervis Estupinan helped injury-hit Brighton record a thumping 4-2 win. Spurs arrived at the Amex Stadium seeking a fourth successive top-flight success to reclaim fourth spot from reigning champions Manchester City. But the north London club were ripped apart as Pedro‚Äôs double and Estupinan‚Äôs thunderbolt added to Jack Hinshelwood‚Äôs opener. Tottenham, who claimed late consolations through substitute Alejo Veliz and Ben Davies, could easily have lost by more as rampant Albion twice hit the woodwork and had a Facundo Buonanotte effort disallowed. Richarlison struck a post for the visitors and was twice denied by the offside flag, while Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg also hit the woodwork. Yet, on this evidence, Champions League qualification looks a distant dream for Ange Postecoglou‚Äôs side, who had registered just one point from 15 before their recent upturn in form. Victory lifts Roberto De Zerbi‚Äôs hosts above Newcastle into eighth. Depleted Brighton were missing eight first-team players while their visitors also had a lengthy list of absentees. One-time Arsenal forward Danny Welbeck should have opened the scoring for Albion inside six minutes when he was twice denied by goalkeeper Guglielmo Vicario, but the Seagulls deservedly edged ahead with 11 minutes on the clock. Tottenham‚Äôs porous defence failed to halt Pedro‚Äôs mazy waltz across the 18-yard box and his offload was emphatically dispatched into the roof of the net by 18-year-old defender Hinshelwood. Brazilian forward Pedro duly doubled the lead with a spot-kick awarded following VAR intervention. Spurs thought they had escaped when Jan Paul van Hecke‚Äôs header from a Pascal Gross corner came back off the right post but replays showed Dejan Kulusevski pulled down Welbeck as he attempted to reach the rebound and Pedro coolly rolled home from 12 yards. Stunned Spurs showed little response and were in danger of falling further behind. James Milner rattled the right post with a superb curling effort before Buonanotte‚Äôs clinical finish was flagged offside. The away side almost gifted Brighton a third when Pedro was sent through by a calamitous back-pass from Pedro Porro, only to see his attempted dink pushed wide by Vicario. Postecoglou would undoubtedly have been happy to reach the break only two behind, albeit his side‚Äôs predicament nearly improved as Richarlison swept against the outside of the left post in added time. The Brazilian then put the ball in the net having already been ruled offside and then curled wide before again being denied by the flag of assistant referee Darren Cann. Tottenham‚Äôs frustration was quickly compounded. Seagulls substitute Estupinan, making his first appearance since November 9 due to injury, did the damage, unleashing a thunderous, dipping effort into the top right corner from around 25 yards following Milner‚Äôs short corner. Tormentor-in-chief Pedro rubbed salt into Spurs‚Äô wounds 15 minutes from time by dispatching his second penalty after Evan Ferguson was brought down by Giovani Lo Celso. Veliz‚Äôs first goal in English football, after Kulusevski and Son Heung-min capitalised on sloppy Seagulls defending, eased the embarrassment before Davies‚Äô header from a Porro cross increased the anxiety among home fans. But Brighton weathered a frantic nine minutes of added time, during which Hojbjerg hit the base of the right post, to claim the points.

author: ABC News
title: Bec Allen ruled out of Opals' Paris Olympics campaign after hamstring injury in final warm-up match - ABC News
text: In short: Opals guard Bec Allen has been ruled out of the Paris Olympics after injuring her hamstring in the team's final warm-up match. She has been replaced in the side by travelling reserve Amy Atwell. What's next? Australia's women's basketball team kicks off its quest for a sixth Olympic medal against Nigeria on Monday, July 29 at 7pm AEST. Rebecca Allen has been left "shattered" after a hamstring injury in the Opals' final warm-up game robbed her of a second Olympic appearance in Paris. The smooth-shooting guard, who plays for the Phoenix Mercury in the WNBA, will be a huge loss for Sandy Brondello's side when the campaign commences against Nigeria on Monday. The 31-year-old aggravated a hamstring injury during the team's final practice match against Canada in Spain on Tuesday. Scans undertaken in Paris determined the extent of the injury, with Allen deemed medically unfit to compete. The setback comes after Allen unknowingly [played in the Opals' charge to 2022 World Cup bronze with a partially collapsed lung and two broken ribs](/news/2022-10-12/opals-bec-allen-diagnosed-with-partial-lung-collapse/101526282). "I have been looking forward to these Games for a long time and am absolutely devastated but I will now focus my energies on recovery and supporting my Opals sisters," she said. Travelling reserve Amy Atwell has been called in as her replacement. [ABC Sport](/news/sport) is live blogging every day of the Paris Olympics "Bec is such a big part of our team and has been for a long time, we are all devastated for her," Brondello said. "This injury has come at a really unfortunate time and the call had to be made upon medical advice. Unfortunately she was not going to recover in time to play in these Games. "Amy Atwell has been part of this Olympic squad all year and with us in Spain for our practice matches. "This group has a really strong bond and connection and we will lock in, stay focused and continue our preparation for game one against Nigeria." The Opals are looking to get back on the Olympic podium for the first time since taking home bronze at London 2012, adding to silvers from Sydney, Athens and Beijing, and a bronze at Atlanta in 1996. They scraped out of the group stage in Tokyo before losing to nine-time gold medallists USA in the quarterfinals. The ABC of SPORT AAP

author: Montserrat Arqu√©
title: Las 10 aerol√≠neas de Estados Unidos con m√°s retrasos y cancelaciones
text:
Las 10 aerol√≠neas de Estados Unidos con m√°s retrasos y cancelaciones
Estas compa√±√≠as a√©reas han tenido problemas con miles de pasajeros debido a cuestiones de puntualidad en sus vuelos
Hoy en d√≠a, algunos de los grandes retos a los que se enfrenta a diario la industria de la aviaci√≥n son la impuntualidad
y las cancelaciones de vuelos, problemas que no solo afecta a los pasajeros, sino tambi√©n merma la imagen y prestigio de las aerol√≠neas.
Ambas situaciones pueden surgir por diversos factores, que van desde condiciones clim√°ticas adversas hasta problemas t√©cnicos en aeronaves. La imprevisibilidad inherente a estos eventos puede provocar interrupciones significativas en los planes de viaje, generando frustraci√≥n y estr√©s en los viajeros.
Adem√°s del impacto en la experiencia del pasajero, la impuntualidad y las cancelaciones tambi√©n tienen implicaciones financieras para las aerol√≠neas y los pasajeros. Las aerol√≠neas pueden enfrentar costos adicionales asociados con la reprogramaci√≥n de vuelos, compensaciones a los pasajeros afectados y p√©rdida de ingresos por asientos vac√≠os. Por otro lado, los pasajeros pueden incurrir en gastos adicionales debido a cambios de planes de viaje de √∫ltimo minuto, como reservas de hotel adicionales o p√©rdida de oportunidades comerciales.
Sobre este tema, con base en datos proporcionados por la Oficina de Estad√≠sticas de Transporte de Estados Unidos,
NerdWallet, una plataforma en l√≠nea que ofrece herramientas y recursos para ayudar a las personas a tomar decisiones financieras que se adapten a sus necesidades, llev√≥ a cabo un an√°lisis respecto a este tema para conocer cu√°les aerol√≠neas en Estados Unidos est√°n atravesando por problemas de puntualidad.
En seguida, te decimos cu√°les son las compa√±√≠as a√©reas del pa√≠s que m√°s retrasos y cancelaciones registran en el √∫ltimo a√±o.
Las 10 aerol√≠neas de Estados Unidos con m√°s retrasos y cancelaciones de vuelos
Encabezando esta lista encontramos a Frontier Airlines que tiene solo un r√©cord de puntualidad del 67%. La aerol√≠nea tambi√©n sufri√≥ retrasos en un 30,71% de sus vuelos y cancelaciones en un 2,13%.
A esta le sigue JetBlue, que ha estado luchando con problemas operativos, sobre todo en los aeropuertos del √°rea de Nueva York, que han contribuido a su baja tasa de puntualidad del 67%; adem√°s, 30,4% de sus vuelos han experimentado retrasos y un 2,1% terminan siendo cancelados.
Tambi√©n encontramos a Spirit Airlines. Situada en el s√©ptimo lugar seg√∫n el an√°lisis, ha registrado un 28,59% en el retraso de sus vuelos, junto con un 1,7% de cancelaciones.
Hawaiian Airlines se posicion√≥ en el sexto lugar seg√∫n el an√°lisis, con el 75,2% de sus vuelos llegando a tiempo. A pesar de este porcentaje relativamente alto de puntualidad, la aerol√≠nea tambi√©n experiment√≥ un notable 23,41% de vuelos retrasados y un 1,3% de cancelaciones.
American Airlines se coloc√≥ en medio de la clasificiaci√≥n, con un considerable 22,74% de vuelos experimentando retrasos y un modesto 1,06% siendo cancelados.
Southwest Airlines ha logrado una mejora notable en su posici√≥n, saltando al cuarto lugar en el an√°lisis, con el 77,25% de sus vuelos llegando a tiempo. A pesar de este progreso, la aerol√≠nea a√∫n enfrenta desaf√≠os, con un 21,55% de sus vuelos experimentando retrasos y un peque√±o porcentaje del 1% siendo cancelados.
United Airlines, pese a registrar una tasa de puntualidad del 78,07%, ha enfrentado una serie de contratiempos en las √∫ltimas semanas, lo que los llev√≥ a tener un 20,27% de vuelos con retrasos y un modesto 1,4% siendo cancelados.
Con solo un 19,42% de vuelos experimentando retrasos y un m√≠nimo 0,81% siendo cancelados, Alaska Airlines ha destacado su compromiso con la eficiencia operativa y la satisfacci√≥n del cliente incluso en circunstancias desafiantes.
Y por √∫ltimo, tenemos a Delta Air Lines, que ha demostrado un rendimiento excepcional al obtener el primer lugar en el an√°lisis, con un impresionante 82,61% de vuelos llegando a tiempo. Delta ha logrado mantener una tasa de retraso relativamente baja, con solo un 16,17% de sus vuelos experimentando demoras, y un m√≠nimo 1,02% siendo cancelados.
Adem√°s, la filial regional de Delta, SkyWest Airlines, tambi√©n ha sobresalido en el an√°lisis, con un s√≥lido 82,46% de puntualidad. A pesar de enfrentar desaf√≠os similares, como el 16,01% de vuelos retrasados y un 1,22% cancelados, ha demostrado una capacidad para mantener altos est√°ndares de rendimiento operativo.
Sigue leyendo:
*
JetBlue ya no se fusionar√° con Spirit Airlines, por decisi√≥n judicial desfavorable
*
United y Delta recortar√°n vuelos a 10 ciudades importantes
*
Las mejores y peores aerol√≠neas de Estados Unidos en 2023

author: Epiphany La'Sha
title: Temple College hosts Keelan Hamilton, NASA researcher and Temple native
text:
TEMPLE, Texas ‚Äî ‚ÄúI‚Äôve always been interested in space especially since the first special launch, I was eight years old when it happened ‚Äî that was like, 'How can I do this? I want to do this ‚Äî how can I get involved in this',‚Äù Keelan Hamilton said.
Keelan Hamilton is a NASA researcher and a Temple Native ‚Äî he attended Meredith Elementary, Travis Middle and graduated from Temple High School in 1990. He stayed in Central Texas for college and took science classes between semesters at Temple College.
‚ÄúThey said 'Oh, you know, just become a science, engineer, doctor or whatever and study hard and see what happens,‚Äù Hamilton said.
"It was just a matter of which direction are you going to go into.‚Äù
He says he joined NASA in 2006 working with the crew and thermal systems division, helping certify items for use on the space shuttle and ISS. Now he serves as the research integration subject matter expert for the international space station research project at NASA‚Äôs Johnson space center.
‚ÄúWe do research objectives we work with the people doing science aboard the space stations,‚Äù Hamilton said.
Temple College in Temple, Hamilton is showing how life is at NASA. Educating our neighbors about space and science and how it‚Äôs important to life on earth. NASA has 20 different locations offering jobs that help with space engineers, IT and cyber security, accountants, administration, writers and researchers.
‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre interested in something, find out as much as you can about it. It doesn‚Äôt have to be science. Just find something to do study hard and work toward it," Hamilton said.

author: Renzo Galiano
title: Mat√≠as Sen, el argentino, el amo del ascenso peruano: perdi√≥ a su padre, sali√≥ campe√≥n, fue doble ‚Äòpichichi‚Äô y ahora vuelve a la Liga 1 tras 10 a√±os
text:
Mat√≠as Sen (C√≥rdoba, 1991) es argentino, pero le debe mucho a Per√∫. Porque su primera experiencia en Primera Divisi√≥n fue en suelo incaico, hace exactamente una d√©cada, de la mano del pintoresco club San Sim√≥n. Pudo celebrar algunos goles, pero no evit√≥ el descenso. A partir de entonces s√≥lo se desempe√±√≥ en clubes de la Liga 2 destacando por su condici√≥n de ‚Äòkiller‚Äô.
Ahora podr√° medir realmente sus capacidades con Comerciantes Unidos, club con el que sali√≥ artillero de Liga 2, en su vuelta a Liga 1. ‚ÄúEstoy en mi mejor momento por mi madurez mental‚Äù, dijo a Infobae Per√∫. El atacante gaucho se consagr√≥ dos a√±os consecutivos como el m√°ximo goleador de la segunda divisi√≥n (2022 y 2023) y sum√≥ su segundo t√≠tulo de su carrera luego de ganar la Copa Bicentenario con Atl√©tico Grau el 2029. Y por si fuera poco, anot√≥ 89 tantos en su paso por Per√∫: cuatro de ellos con San Sim√≥n en la m√°xima categor√≠a.
-Ni bien empez√≥ su carrera como profesional, hace m√°s de una d√©cada, inmediatamente conect√≥ con Per√∫.
S√≠. Arranqu√© en las inferiores de Newell‚Äôs Old Boys, despu√©s debut√© en Desamparados de San Juan y San Mart√≠n (SJ) y finalmente vine a San Sim√≥n, en 2014.
-Usted se da a conocer aqu√≠ jugando para el humilde San Sim√≥n. ¬øC√≥mo fue esa inesperada aventura?
Por ah√≠ en lo deportivo fue bueno, pero en lo grupal nos toc√≥ descender. Fue mi primera experiencia en el exterior y fue lindo dentro de todo.
-Habi√©ndose hecho un espacio en Per√∫, ¬øpor qu√© decidi√≥ regresar al ascenso de su pa√≠s con Villa San Carlos?
Porque en lo econ√≥mico no me fue tan bien, no nos cumplieron y por eso nos sacaron de Segunda Divisi√≥n con San Sim√≥n por incumplimiento de pago y me sali√≥ la oportunidad de Villa San Carlos.
-¬øQu√© lo motiv√≥ a una revancha por estos lares?
Despu√©s me fui a Chile, a Uni√≥n La Calera, y cuando estaba all√° me llam√≥ el ‚ÄòChecho‚Äô (Sergio Ibarra) para ir a Cienciano. Me motiv√≥ la grandeza del desaf√≠o.
-Menciona usted al ‚ÄòChecho‚Äô Ibarra. ¬øC√≥mo fue la relaci√≥n entre ambos?
La verdad que es un tipazo, muy buena gente. Un buen t√©cnico, trabajaba todos los detalles muy bien. Fue muy lindo conocerlo.
-A partir de entonces s√≥lo ha jugado en Liga 2. ¬øA qu√© se debi√≥?
Me llamaron varias veces equipos de Primera Divisi√≥n, pero por temas econ√≥micos no cerr√°bamos. Ahora estoy en Comerciantes Unidos con un lindo desaf√≠o. Ojal√° pueda aprovecharlo de la mejor manera.
-¬øC√≥mo valora su carrera en la segunda divisi√≥n?
Estoy muy contento por lo que me toc√≥ vivir. Creo que soy uno de los m√°ximos goleadores. Siempre me he preparado de la mejor manera para ayudar a los equipos con goles.
-¬øQu√© etapa disfrut√≥ m√°s?
Todos los equipos tuvieron sus cosas. Por ah√≠, en Cienciano se peleaba por el ascenso y con Atl√©tico Grau ganamos la Copa Centenario. En todos lados hubo etapas lindas.
-Hace un mes gan√≥ su primer t√≠tulo liguero coincidiendo con el acceso a Liga 1. ¬øC√≥mo vivi√≥ todo ello con Comerciantes Unidos?
Fue algo lindo conseguir el t√≠tulo y ascender a Primera Divisi√≥n como goleador y capit√°n. Me lo hab√≠a propuesto a inicios de a√±o hacerlo y m√°s cuando me toc√≥ la p√©rdida de mi ‚Äòviejo‚Äô. As√≠ que no pens√© otra cosa en conseguir ese objetivo.
-Adem√°s se constituy√≥ como el goleador de la temporada con 20 goles. ¬øAcaso su mejor promedio?
Fue la mayor cantidad de goles que hice, pero en promedio fue en Sport Chavelines que met√≠ 13 goles en la misma cantidad de partidos.
-Despu√©s de una d√©cada exactamente volver√° a disputar la m√°xima categor√≠a. ¬øQu√© metas se ha propuesto?
La meta personal es prepararme de la mejor manera para aprovechar las situaciones y en lo grupal ir partido a partido para ver en qu√© estamos. Lo importante es que estamos haciendo una buena pretemporada con un lindo grupo.
-¬øSiente que est√° en su mejor momento?
S√≠, creo que por la madurez mental. Por ah√≠ en lo f√≠sico pasan los a√±os y uno tiene que resolver de otra manera. No se corre como cuando tienes 20 a√±os, pero ganas otras referencias.
-Una curiosidad. ¬øC√≥mo es la convivencia en un vestuario con un crisol de nacionalidades?
La verdad que es linda la convivencia porque hay muy buena gente que te permite trabajar de la mejor manera.
-Hablando del camerino, ¬øQu√© tal es su relaci√≥n con Kevin Santamar√≠a?
Con Kevin hemos entablado una muy buena relaci√≥n, es con quien m√°s comparto. Es un jugadorazo; sal√≠ goleador gracias a √©l. Te mete cada pase que otros no ven.
-¬øUsted tiene todos sus papeles en regla como ciudadano peruano?
No, todav√≠a no. Lo estoy tramitando.
-Termino. Despu√©s de m√°s de diez a√±os en el Per√∫, ¬øse ha acostumbrado a su f√∫tbol, sociedad y costumbres?
S√≠, la verdad que estoy acostumbrado a todo. Por ah√≠ lo que me cuesta un poco es la comida, pero me he acostumbrado bastante. Tengo mi esposa que es de ac√° y mis hijas nacieron en Cusco. La verdad que es un pa√≠s muy lindo que me recibi√≥ bien.

author: Leonard Pinth-Garnell
title: Re: 'Worst Show Ever': Activists Reenact What's Happening in Gaza in Front of the White House
text: Whatever happened to [that hunger strike](https://twitchy.com/brettt/2023/11/27/author-of-palestine-a-socialist-introduction-announces-hunger-strike-in-front-of-white-house-n2390224) that was going on in front of the White House to pressure President Biden to call for a ceasefire in Gaza? "Sex and the City" actress Cynthia Nixon was part of it, so it was kind of high-profile. That just disappeared. And then there were masked White House staffers who gathered in front of the White House and spelled out "ceasefire" in candles. But this ‚Ä¶ this is art. If your eyes weren't opened before to the atrocities Israel is committing in Gaza, they are now. Watch as Israel's genocide is acted out. In front of the White House, activists stage a performance to expose what‚Äôs happening to Palestinian citizens in Gaza‚Äî Sarah Wilkinson (@swilkinsonbc) [#StopGazaGenocide] [pic.twitter.com/6OgeqylDxz] [December 28, 2023] Not even the press is safe. We especially like the slow-motion shots of the milk jugs of red liquid tipping over. So much blood! The original poster says in her bio that she wants "an end to the illegal Israeli occupation of Palestine," so we don't know if she filmed it or is just passing it along. In any case, it's brutal to watch. Theater kids cosplaying terrorists. Worst show ever.‚Äî Whateverdear (@WhateverDearest) [December 28, 2023] There is nothing real about anything these people do. We raised too many theatre kids and this is how they act out.‚Äî LaborIsMoney (@scrotus2024) [December 28, 2023] Fake babies and theatrics. Exactly like‚Äî Moral Tourism (@moraltourism) [#Pallywood]in Gaza. ü§°üáÆüá± [December 28, 2023] Remember the woman crying over [the obvious baby doll](https://twitchy.com/coucy/2023/12/01/palestinian-doll-baby-n2390379) she was passing around? That's Pallywood. Who cares? Not this American.‚Äî Clay (@MoodyBlueshirt) [December 28, 2023] Do they take requests? Can they recreate the opening battle from Gladiator next?‚Äî Turbulence Modeling (@eskomobar) [December 28, 2023] Wow, using dolls and having a Hamas terrorist pretending to a journo - it‚Äôs just like what‚Äôs happening in Gaza!‚Äî Super Journalist (Ret) - JOURN-L of Skrypton (@Magnum_CK) [December 28, 2023] [December 28, 2023] Bullying theater kids is a good thing, actually‚Äî Corv (@Corvaiex) [December 28, 2023] Did they also perform the rape and murder of 1200 Jews?‚Äî Scottie (@BuffaloBlueBear) BTW, If you‚Äôre spending $150k for a degree in theatre and this is net result, you deserve to be unemployed [December 28, 2023] No different than Gaza, eh? Agitprop performative propaganda.‚Äî DriveByGeek (@DriveByGeek) [December 28, 2023] You‚Äôre telling me they‚Äôre wasting all the KoolAid and chalk and we‚Äôre just going to do nothing about this. üòÇ‚Äî Josh Munoz (@SenorChoppy) [December 28, 2023] This isn‚Äôt a performance. It‚Äôs a bunch of nerds lying in the middle of a juice covered street.‚Äî Who is John Galt? (@MikeHoncho7258) [December 28, 2023] I was really hoping the press would be killed too. 10/10‚Äî Bookhouseboy (@Lilliputianhead) [December 28, 2023] We'll admit it was oddly satisfying when the guy in the "Press" jacket got chalked. They aren‚Äôt mentally stable these lot.‚Äî Robbie (@Robbie555666) [December 28, 2023] üòÇüòÇüòÇ EXCELLENT! Show us what happens when dumbasses think starting a war is a good idea.‚Äî Jan Wolff üá∫üá¶ (@JanWolf20176202) [December 28, 2023] They obviously got together and rehearsed this thing and filmed it thinking it might actually have any effect on U.S. foreign policy. This is just embarrassing and an insult to the memory of those slaughtered on October 7. *** [Join Twitchy VIP](https://twitchy.com/page/subscribe/?tpcc=twitchyvipgeneric)and use the promo code SAVEAMERICA to get 40% off your VIP membership!

author: OneAdmin
title: Applied Intuition Announces Favorable Resolution of Securities Complaint
text:
MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Dec. 28, 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- As previously disclosed, on May 25, 2023, Embark Technology, Inc. ("Embark") and Applied Intuition, Inc. ("Applied") entered into an Agreement and Plan of Merger, pursuant to which, among other matters, Azara Merger Sub, Inc. merged with and into Embark, with Embark continuing as the surviving corporation and as a wholly owned subsidiary of Applied (the "Merger").
On June 26, 2023, a putative class action complaint was filed in the Court of Chancery of the State of Delaware ("Court") by Marceil A. Hanshew, a stockholder of Embark ("Plaintiff"), against Embark and the then-members of Embark's Board of Directors (collectively, "Defendants"), captioned Marceil A. Hanshew v. Embark Technology, Inc. et al., C.A. No. 2023-0654-NAC (the "Action"). The complaint alleged that the disclosures made in the preliminary proxy statement on Schedule 14A filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the "SEC") on June 16, 2023, in connection with the Merger, contained false and misleading statements. The complaint sought, among other forms of relief, a preliminary injunction to enjoin the Merger.
On June 26, 2023, Embark filed a definitive proxy statement on Schedule 14A with the SEC ("Proxy"), and on June 29, 2023, Plaintiff and Plaintiff's spouse, David L. Hanshew (collectively, "Plaintiffs"), filed an amended complaint captioned David L. Hanshew in His Capacity as Attorney-in-Fact for Marceil A. Hanshew and Marceil A. Hanshew v. Embark Technology, Inc. et al., C.A. No. 2023-0654-NAC.
To resolve the Action, Plaintiffs and Defendants ultimately agreed that Embark would make certain additional disclosures, which Embark made in Amendment No. 1 to the Proxy filed with the SEC on July 10, 2023 (the "July 10 Amendment").
On August 1, 2023, Plaintiffs voluntarily dismissed the Action as moot, and later that day, the Court entered a stipulated order dismissing the Action with prejudice as to the Plaintiffs and without prejudice as to any actual or potential claims of any other member(s) of the putative class. The Court retained jurisdiction solely for the purpose of adjudicating Plaintiffs' counsel's anticipated application for an award of attorneys' fees and reimbursement of expenses in connection with the disclosures in the July 10 Amendment.
In order to avoid the time and expense of continued litigation, Applied, as successor in interest of Embark, subsequently agreed to pay $114,000 to Plaintiffs' counsel for attorneys' fees and expenses in full satisfaction of their claim for attorneys' fees and expenses in the Action. On December 21, 2023, the Court entered an order closing the case, subject to Applied filing an affidavit with the Court confirming that this notice has been issued. In entering the order, the Court was not asked to review, and did not pass judgment on, the payment of the attorneys' fees and expenses or their reasonableness.
View original content:
SOURCE Applied Intuition, Inc.

author: Pierce Atwood LLP
title: Can a Person Ever Establish Zoning Standing by Alleging Diminution in Property Value? The Appeals Court Whispers the Answer
text: The Massachusetts Appeals Court recently addressed diminution of property value as a basis for standing to file a zoning appeal. In [Pobeda RT II, LLC v. Zoning Bd. of Appeals of Watertown](https://www.massdirtlaw.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Pobeda-RT-II-LLC-v.-Zoning-Board-of-Appeals-of-Watertown.pdf), the court affirmed that individual property value, by itself, isn‚Äôt a protected interest that can serve as a basis for standing to appeal a zoning decision. Rather, property value must be tethered to a different interest protected by the zoning ordinance at issue, such as preservation of views, light, or space. Pobeda is an appeal of a special permit approving the construction of a three-story, 88,572-square-foot research facility in an industrial zone in Watertown. The plaintiff, Pobeda RT II, LLC (Pobeda), owns abutting property in a residential district and was a party in interest presumed to be aggrieved. Pobeda alleged that the research facility would ‚Äúseverely devalue‚Äù its residential property. The project proponent, Cresset/WS Venture LLC (Cresset), moved for summary judgment, seeking to rebut Pobeda‚Äôs presumed standing with expert affidavits on some assertions of aggrievement (e.g., noise, air quality, light), but also arguing that property value isn‚Äôt an interest protected by Watertown‚Äôs zoning ordinance under the circumstances. The superior court granted summary judgment in Cresset‚Äôs favor, and the Appeals Court affirmed. Pobeda travels a well-worn path. On appeal, Pobeda argued that the superior court erred in holding, as a matter of law, that the Watertown zoning ordinance didn‚Äôt protect property value under the circumstances. That argument flies in the face of prior appellate decisions establishing that diminished property value does not provide standing unless it relates to ‚Äúcognizable interests protected by the applicable zoning scheme.‚Äù [Kenner v. Zoning Bd. of Appeals of Chatham](http://masscases.com/cases/sjc/459/459mass115.html), 459 Mass. 115, 123 (2011). The court held that a general reference to ‚Äúconserving the value of land and buildings‚Äù in the purposes section of a zoning ordinance doesn‚Äôt make conservation of property value a protected interest in all instances. It doesn‚Äôt place individual economic interests over community interests, such as protecting public health and safety. Perhaps if Pobeda had successfully tied its alleged diminution in property value to a real threat to public health and safety, it would have established aggrievement. Instead, the court found that Pobeda only raised speculative concerns and stigma associated with biolabs. The Appeals Court‚Äôs analysis doesn‚Äôt break new ground. But a brief footnote raises the specter of bigger things to come. In footnote five, the court took pains to say that it was leaving ‚Äúthe question of whether a plaintiff can ever succeed in showing that a zoning bylaw protects individual property values for another day.‚Äù Indeed, if property value diminution must always be tethered to some other interest, then there is no reason it would ever be a basis for standing. Rather, it‚Äôs more accurately viewed as a concrete way of proving other intangible harms. For instance, if a zoning ordinance protects against deprivation of light and air, then a plaintiff could argue that a tall, bulky building approved by special permit deprives it of light and air, and that this deprivation can be quantified by diminished property value. But it seems like the plaintiff would be taking on more than necessary. So, perhaps diminished property value, as a ground for standing, is on its last legs, waiting for the coup de grace, and the court has just whispered that it‚Äôs coming.
